evidence: The key idea here is that the human visual system does not respond to absolute changes in brightness, but rather to relative changes.
This is exactly what Weber’s law describes.
The contrast term in SSIM naturally captures this idea - it reflects the fact that our visual system is tuned to relative, not absolute, differences.
So the contrast term in SSIM naturally captures this idea - it reflects the fact that our visual system is tuned to relative, not absolute, differences.

concepts.term: it reflects the fact that our visual system is tuned to relative, not absolute, differences
